009
010package imagingbook.common.regions;
011
012import java.util.Deque;
013import java.util.LinkedList;
014
015import ij.process.ByteProcessor;
016import imagingbook.common.geometry.basic.NeighborhoodType2D;
017import imagingbook.common.geometry.basic.Pnt2d.PntInt;
018
019/**
020 * <p> 
021 * Binary region segmentation based on a depth-first flood filling algorithm
022 * using a stack. See Sec. 8.1.1 (Alg. 8.2) of [1] for additional details.
023 * </p>
024 * <p>
025 * [1] W. Burger, M.J. Burge, <em>Digital Image Processing - An Algorithmic
026 * Approach</em>, 3rd ed, Springer (2022).
027 * </p>
028 * 
029 * @author WB
030 * @version 2020/04/01
031 * @version 2022/09/28 revised
032 */
033public class DepthFirstSegmentation extends BinaryRegionSegmentation {
034        
035        /**
036         * Constructor. Creates a new region segmentation from the specified image,
037         * which is not modified. The input image is considered binary, with 0 values
038         * for background pixels and values &ne; 0 for foreground pixels.
039         * The 4-neighborhood is used by default ({@link DEFAULT_NEIGHBORHOOD}).
040         * 
041         * @param ip the binary input image to be segmented
042         */
043        public DepthFirstSegmentation(ByteProcessor ip) {
044                this(ip, DEFAULT_NEIGHBORHOOD);
045        }
046        
047        /**
048         * Constructor. Creates a new region segmentation from the specified image and
049         * neighborhood type (4- or 8-neighborhood). The input image is considered
050         * binary, with 0 values for background pixels and values &ne; 0 for foreground
051         * pixels.
052         * 
053         * @param ip the binary input image to be segmented
054         * @param nh the neighborhood type (4- or 8-neighborhood)
055         */
056        public DepthFirstSegmentation(ByteProcessor ip, NeighborhoodType2D nh) {
057                super(ip, nh);
058        }
059        
060        @Override
061        boolean applySegmentation(ByteProcessor ip) {
062                for (int v = 0; v < height; v++) {
063                        for (int u = 0; u < width; u++) {
064                                if (getLabel(u, v) == FOREGROUND) {
065                                        // start a new region
066                                        int label = getNextLabel();
067                                        //IJ.log(String.format("assigning label %d at (%d,%d), maxLabel=%d", label, u, v, maxLabel));
068                                        floodFill(u, v, label);
069                                }
070                        }
071                }
072                return true;
073        }
074
075        private void floodFill(int u, int v, int label) {
076                Deque<PntInt> S = new LinkedList<>();   //stack contains pixel coordinates
077                S.push(PntInt.from(u, v));
078                while (!S.isEmpty()){
079                        PntInt p = S.pop();
080                        int x = p.x;
081                        int y = p.y;
082                        if ((x >= 0) && (x < width) && (y >= 0) && (y < height) && getLabel(x, y) == FOREGROUND) {
083                                setLabel(x, y, label);
084                                S.push(PntInt.from(x + 1, y));
085                                S.push(PntInt.from(x, y + 1));
086                                S.push(PntInt.from(x, y - 1));
087                                S.push(PntInt.from(x - 1, y));
088                                if (NT == NeighborhoodType2D.N8) {
089                                        S.push(PntInt.from(x + 1, y + 1));
090                                        S.push(PntInt.from(x - 1, y + 1));
091                                        S.push(PntInt.from(x + 1, y - 1));
092                                        S.push(PntInt.from(x - 1, y - 1));
093                                }
094                        }
095                }
096        }
097
098}
